intro: Dichaelia undulata, commonly known as the wavy dichaelia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, opposite leaves with a wavy margin. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, clustered in cymes, and bloom during the rainy season. It is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and thickets.
